title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: China tops the world in artificial intelligence publications, database analysis reveals
items.description: The country also leads in patent filings and the number of AI researchers

items.title: Effort to revive New Zealand’s extinct moa stirs controversy
items.description: Suggestions that nation’s Indigenous Māori wholeheartedly back project draws criticism

items.title: Astronomers race to study interstellar interloper
items.description: Phalanx of instruments scrutinize 3I/ATLAS for clues about planet formation elsewhere in the galaxy

items.title: U.S. abandons hunt for signal of cosmic inflation
items.description: Now-canceled CMB-S4 project would have searched the afterglow of the Big Bang for signs of cosmic exponential growth spurt

items.title: Genetic testing of critically ill adults can yield surprises—and reveal disparities in treatment of Black patients
items.description: Adults in the ICU often don’t know about the genetic diagnoses related to their symptoms, DNA sequencing study shows

items.title: How hydrogen-leaking ‘fairy circles’ might form
items.description: Understanding the origins of mysterious seeps could help prospectors extract natural hydrogen fuel

items.title: NIH director is replacing his top outside advisory board
items.description: Some worry new members of the long-running Advisory Committee to the Director will mirror agency chief Jay Bhattacharya’s views

items.title: Senate spending panel would rescue NSF and NASA science funding
items.description: Its support for a flat budget is a sign of congressional resistance to drastic cuts Trump has proposed

items.title: Quantum computers made of individual atoms leap to the fore
items.description: After decades in the doldrums, atom-based machines could overtake rival technologies

items.title: Giant radar satellite set to probe Earth’s shifts and shudders
items.description: NASA and India’s $1.5 billion NISAR mission promises global time lapses of the planet’s ever-changing land and ice
